title: Bug 3622: New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622: New Package Wizard has confusing message
OB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard, the following message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists.' The package name field is empty at this point. Unsure about the meaning and intent of this message. It is not clear whether this message indicates an error or if it should be displayed as an error with the red error icon.
EB: The New Package Wizard should not display any warning or error message when the package name field is empty. Additionally, the 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' message should be clarified or removed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new Java Project. 
2. Select the newly created project. 
3. Invoke the New Package Wizard.
